com.isotrol.impe3.pms.gui.client.controllers
Class PortalsController

java.lang.Object
  com.extjs.gxt.ui.client.data.ChangeEventSupport
      com.isotrol.impe3.pms.gui.client.controllers.PortalsController
All Implemented Interfaces:
com.extjs.gxt.ui.client.data.ChangeEventSource, IPortalsServiceAsync
public class PortalsController
extends com.extjs.gxt.ui.client.data.ChangeEventSupport
implements IPortalsServiceAsync

Wrapper for the Portals async service with events capabilities

Author:
Andrei Cojocaru, Manuel Ruiz

save

public void save(PortalDTO dto,
                 com.google.gwt.user.client.rpc.AsyncCallback<Void> callback)
Saves the passed template and fires an event of type Add (new item, with no ID) or Update (already existing item). The resulting portal template can be accessed by calling PmsChangeEvent.getEventInfo()
(non-Javadoc)

Specified by:
save in interface IPortalsServiceAsync
Parameters:
dto - Portal to save.
See Also:
#save(com.isotrol.impe3.pms.api.portal.PortalDTO, com.google.gwt.user.client.rpc.AsyncCallback)

delete

public void delete(String id,
                   com.google.gwt.user.client.rpc.AsyncCallback<PortalTreeDTO> callback)
Deletes the portal with the passed ID and fires a ChangeEventSource.Remove event. The resulting portal tree can be accessed by calling PmsChangeEvent.getEventInfo().
(non-Javadoc)

Specified by:
delete in interface IPortalsServiceAsync
See Also:
#delete(java.lang.String, com.google.gwt.user.client.rpc.AsyncCallback)
